rev.comment: It's not one philosophy but many
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 265018127 by [[Special:Contributions/Jadabocho|Jadabocho]] ([[User talk:Jadabocho|talk]]) Revert deletion of sourced material.
/* Anarchist communism= */ This is nonsense. Anarcho-communism is of course communitarian whether the communist is an egoist or not.
/* Anarchist communism */ This is wrong. All houses and land would be owned by the commune. Kropotkin here is talking about people who didnt wish to join.
not sourced, not a summary of [[platformism]], not a description, not in [[anarchist schools of thought]]; take your pick.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 265013558 by [[Special:Contributions/Skomorokh|Skomorokh]] ([[User talk:Skomorokh|talk]]) Que? Errico Malatesta was a communist...
Nothing dubious about this ........the sources check out.
this is meant as a summary of what anarchist communism is; including the opinions of non-communists gives [[WP:UNDUE|undue weight]]
/* Anarchist communism */ Platformism as a viable tendency. Further and better information. http://flag.blackened.net/revolt/platform/discussion.html
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Anarchist communism */ the communist slogan makes all anarchists communists and my addition here helps complete a seperate paragraph
/* Anarchist communism */ removed [[WP:OR|original research]]; please do not add [[WP:V|unreferenced]] content
can we get some quotes from the sources cited? This assertion seems very dubious.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 264966382 by [[Special:Contributions/75.51.72.237|75.51.72.237]] ([[User talk:75.51.72.237|talk]]) Don't delete sourced information
anarchism is NOT a synonym for libertarianism
you changed the meaning stated by the source....this preserves it
Sounds better than two "or other" clauses in a row.
"Free-market anarchist" is what the link goes to, not "market anarchist", which is already dealt with in the next sentence.
Fixing circumlocution to make wording more concise.

without being thoroughly sourced, the same questions and requests for sources will come up over and over

libertarianism is synonym for anarchism. never heard of libertarian socialism as distinguished from state socialism?
/* Egoist anarchism */ libertarian communist an anarcho-communist is the same thing. libertarian means anarchist in anarchist-speak.
enough of this nonsense; I'm moving this per [[WP:UNDUE]] and a [[WP:SPA]] who's trying to make a [[WP:POINT]]
this sentence just doens't make sense in this location ..moving
something needed to be done about first line. Technology is not a separate entity. Primitivists do support some forms of technology; just not those based on large-scale organization
accuracy of this claim is disputed on the talkpage by Maziotis and others
merging successive single-use refs inserted for [[WP:POINT]]
references follow punctutation; duplication is pointless
restoring edits reverted by Costho in their single-purpose crusade
sources say it's a frequent synonym. therefore it's not undue weight.
/* Further reading */ a little too much detail
etymology belongs in footnote; undue weight in lede
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 263440045 by [[Special:Contributions/Skomorokh|Skomorokh]] ([[User talk:Skomorokh|talk]]) reverting obscuring of synonym. this is not a rare synonym but a frequent one
previous edit summaries did not make any sense; this version preserves the libertarianism claim and its references while avoiding undue weight
libertarianism is often used as a synonym
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 263317269 by [[Special:Contributions/81.104.177.0|81.104.177.0]] ([[User talk:81.104.177.0|talk]]) Nope, civilization in general. That means agriculture goes too.
footnoting per talk, convention with [[Individualist_anarchism#endnote_Fnone|individualist anarchism footnoting]]
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 263166427 by [[Special:Contributions/Maziotis|Maziotis]] ([[User alk:Maziotis|talk]]) It's not definition. It's a common synonym.
"though that term sometimes has other meanings as well"?!!! The article shouldn't start with such an ambiguous definition. I do believe the term connection should be mentioned in the article.
have a source that says this is used often? that was the standard met for the "libertarianism" synonym.
If you're going to include one synonym, you should include others (in this case, more common).

I' not very sure, but I believe it was an old synonimous

could be left or right (I ask, Is this little line necessary?), I put also an interwiki

the reference cited obvously refers to it as left-libertarian and not as clamed the totaly different concept of kust libritarianism
Just say no to "orientate". Other minor copyediting.
Limiting "government" to "the state" is only one POV; many anarchists define all hierarchical institutions as "government".
spunk is the same line of theylie, and is discontinued
stop vandalising the quote - it's viewable right here:http://books.google.com/books?id=gHyUj9HFYBIC&pg=PP15
Confusing source's distinction between classical liberalism with neoliberalism (American liberalism).
